articles.title: We would scrap two-child benefit cap to make it easier to have children, says Farage
articles.description: Reform leader backs lifting the two-child benefit cap and introducing more generous tax breaks for married people.
articles.ai_summary: Reform leader backs lifting the two-child benefit cap and introducing more generous tax breaks for married people. Reform leader backs lift of the two child benefit cap.

articles.title: Ministers considering scrapping two-child benefit cap
articles.description: The education secretary says the policy pushes people into poverty but warns scrapping it would be costly.
articles.ai_summary: The education secretary says the policy pushes people into poverty. But he warns scrapping it would be costly. He says: 'It is not a policy that should be scrapped. It is a policy to help people out of poverty'

articles.title: Higher-level apprenticeship funding to be scrapped as focus shifts to under-22s
articles.description: The government will no longer fund some courses for older learners in order to boost entry level training places.
articles.ai_summary: The government will no longer fund some courses for older learners. The aim is to boost entry level training places for new recruits.

articles.title: Streeting urges doctors to vote no in strike ballot
articles.description: Resident doctors unhappy with 5.4% pay rise with union warning strikes in England could return.
articles.ai_summary: Resident doctors unhappy with 5.4% pay rise with union warning strikes in England could return. Resident doctors in England are unhappy with pay rise of 5.3%.

articles.title: Farage defends Reform advert after racism claims
articles.description: A video posted by the party on social media has sparked complaints from Scottish Labour and the SNP.
articles.ai_summary: A video posted by the party on social media has sparked complaints. Scottish Labour and the SNP have complained about the video.
